thread.title: Restaurant inspections: Greene County Health Inspections
thread.title_full: Restaurant inspections: Greene County Health Inspections | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Staff
title: Restaurant inspections: Greene County Health Inspections
text:
The following are summaries of state of Ohio standard inspection reports on file from the Greene County Combined Health District, from the week of Aug. 17-21. District information is available online at www.gcchd.org/inspections.
Stan’s Bar & Grill
757 W. Second St., Xenia
Date of inspection: Aug. 17
Violations: Found the following areas in need of repair:
- paint peeling on wall in hallway leading to walk in freezer for frozen foods sold in the store
- damage to wall near wine bottle storage in store
- cove base missing and coming off wall near walk in freezer for store
- damaged tile near base of cabinet under rockstar cooler
- water stained ceiling tile over general merchandise are in store, men’s restroom, women’s restroom, and bar area
Found pre-existing non commercial microwaves in use in the store, and in the bar. When these microwaves need replaced, they must be replaced with commercial equipment.
Found soda nozzles in store unclean. Additionally, found the interior of the ice machine in the bar unclean (correcting all).
Found the tracks to beer coolers in the bar unclean. Found interior of creamer machine with build up present.
Found undated creamer in creamer machine (correcting).
Found interior of beer coolers lines with towels, in bar.
Found air vents on ceiling, and ceiling tiles unclean.
WalMart
3360 Pentagon Road, Beavercreek
Date of inspection: Aug. 18
Violations: Hand sink in deli blocked by cart (corrected).
Found last coliform test taken 5/6/14 (vendor contacted).
Found dry food soils on exterior of storage bins in deli (correcting).
Found serving spoons in disarray in storage bins (correcting).
Found damaged cove base in deli.
Found dry food soils along base under utensil sink in deli, by doors in bakery.
Quaker Steak & Lube
3725 Presidential Drive, Beavercreek
Date of inspection: Aug. 18
Violations: Found multiple containers without common names present.
Found a multitude of items out of temperature due to the walk in cooler not working properly. All TCS items stored in the walk in cooler were discarded. Ambient air temperature was 50F with most items temping around 48F.
Found items held longer than 7 days in the walk in cooler, other items not datemarked, and other marked for more than 7 days. All items were discarded.
Found time in lieu of temperature procedure being utilized without a written procedure in place and the time removed from temp control and discard times not marked. Addressed with PIC. Corrected the times – PIC will work on writing a procedure.
Found tongs missing sections of plastic handle. Corrected.
Found a new microwave in the kitchen but it is not commercial grade. Remove and replace with a commercial grade unit.
Found the walk in cooler not working properly and the grate for the Pepsi machine broken.
Found sticker residue on lexan containers, residue in the soda nozzles, and mold growth in the ice machine.
Found the areas between the fryers, sides, and fronts need a detailed cleaning as well as the paper towel dispensers, and the gaskets of the reach in units need cleaned.
Found most recently washed items in the facility wet nested.
Found the right bar hand sink blocked. Corrected.
Comments: Call the health district to schedule reinspection for the walk in cooler 937-374-5618. Do not place new TCS items into the cooler until approval is granted by the health district to do so. All other violations will be evaluated during a re-inspection on or after 9/3/15.
